summary: Anna K. Nelson was a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). The documents mention her in the context of the ARRB's work to declassify and release JFK assassination records. She was involved in the process of security clearances for ARRB members and staff, coordination with agencies like the CIA and FBI, and making formal determinations regarding the public disclosure of CIA records related to the JFK assassination. She also participated in the multi-agency review of Joseph Califano's Army papers and Joint Staff/JCS records. The documents span from 1994 to 1998, indicating her involvement throughout the ARRB's active period. The documents also include her biography as an ARRB member.
significance: As a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB), Anna K. Nelson played a significant role in the declassification and release of records related to the JFK assassination. Her involvement was crucial in ensuring transparency and facilitating public access to information surrounding the event.
